REMARK- Hearing was set for an initial appearance and an arraignment. Defendant Bryan David Mitchell was present. Court appointed the Federal Public Defenders office to represent the defendant. Defendant disrupted the proceedings. Court canceled the hearing. Hearing will be reset. Court instructed the USMS to provide a room where the defendant may participate by video. Defendant was remanded to the custody of the USMS. (ss) (Entered: 10/21/2008)
NOTICE OF ATTORNEY APPEARANCE: Robert L. Steele appearing for Bryan David Mitchell (Steele, Robert) (Entered: 10/21/2008)
RESPONSE to Motion by Bryan David Mitchell re 9 MOTION for Hearing To Determine the Mental Competency of Defendant (Killpack, Steven) (Entered: 10/24/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Magistrate Judge Samuel Alba. Initial Appearance,arraignment as to Bryan David Mitchell held on 10/24/2008. Defendant present and in custody. Court asked counsel to have Mr. Mitchell to refrain from singing. Mr. Mitchell continued disrupting the proceedings. Court had the defendant removed from the courtroom and placed in an area where he was able to hear and see the proceedings. This was confirmed by Deputy Monks. Mr. Mitchell was also accompanied by counsel, Mr. Steele. Charging document read, rights and penalties explained. Court entered a plea of not guilty for the defendant. Court requested that any and all reports regarding the defendant be made available to court and the FPD office by 10/31/08. Government has until 10/31/08 to file their response to defendant's memorandum in opposition to the motion for a competency hearing. After reviewing the documents and briefs, Court will make a determination of whether to send the defendant for a competency evaluation. Pretrial Conference as to Bryan David Mitchell held on 10/24/2008. Discovery due by 11/7/2008, Motions due by 12/3/2008, Fourteen day Jury Trial set for 12/22/2008 08:30 AM before Judge Dale A. Kimball. Court set the matter for a status conference on 11/12/2008 at 10:00 AM before Magistrate Judge Samuel Alba. Attorney for Plaintiff: Brett Tolman, Richard Lambert, Dave Backman, Diana Hagen, Attorney for Defendant: Steve Killpack, Bob Steele, Parker Douglas, fpd. Court Reporter: Becky Janke. (ss) (Entered: 10/28/2008)
REPLY TO RESPONSE to Motion by USA as to Bryan David Mitchell re 9 MOTION for Hearing To Determine the Mental Competency of Defendant (Hagen, Diana) (Entered: 10/31/2008)

REPLY TO RESPONSE to Motion by USA as to Bryan David Mitchell re 9 MOTION for Hearing To Determine the Mental Competency of Defendant SECOND REPLY (Attachments: # 1 Procedures for Examination, # 2 Local Competency Evaluations, # 3 Committed Competency Evaluations)(Hagen, Diana) (Entered: 11/10/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Samuel Alba. Defendant present in custody with counsel. Defendant began singing during the proceedings. Court asked the defendant if he would sit quietly and listen to the proceedings. Counsel stated on the record that the defendant has been non responsive with them as well. Court ordered that Mr. Mitchell be removed from the courtroom and placed in an area where he will be able to see and hear the proceedings without disrupting them. Counsel for the defendant stated on the record that Mr. Steele will be present with the defendant during the proceedings. USMS confirmed that the defendant was now in the holding cell and was able to hear and see the proceedings. After hearing arguments from counsel, Court granted the 9 MOTION for Hearing To Determine the Mental Competency of Defendant filed by USA. Court ordered the defendant be sent, in the custody of the USMS, transferred to the Bureau of Prisons for an inpatient mental competency evaluation. Due to the defendant appearing on a writ from state custody the 22 MOTION for a detention hearing is moot. Defendant will remain in the custody of the USMS. Court ordered the government to prepare an order. Attorney for Plaintiff: Brett Tolman, Dave Backman, Diana Hagen, Richard Lambert, AUSA, Attorney for Defendant: Steve Killpack, Parker Douglas, Audrey James, Bob Steele, fpd. Court Reporter: Electronic.(Time Start: 13:05, Time End: 36:38, Room 248.) (ss) (Entered: 11/14/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Samuel Alba. Status Conference as to Brian David Mitchell held on 2/27/2009. Defendant present with counsel. Defendant began singing when he entered the courtroom. Defendant continued singing while Judge began talking. Judge had the defendant removed from the proceedings and taken to a room where the defendant can hear but cannot disrupt the proceedings. USMS confirmed that the defendant could hear the proceedings. Government stated that they are in the process of retaining a forensic expert. Counsel requested more time to obtain copies of all documents and tapes of interviews. Court set the matter for a status conference on 4/8/2009 at 09:00 AM before Magistrate Judge Samuel Alba. Defendant does not need to be present for this hearing. Attorney for Plaintiff: Richard Lambert, Brett Tolman, AUSA, Attorney for Defendant: Bob Steele, fpd. Court Reporter: Patti Walker. (ss) (Entered: 02/27/2009)

NOTICE OF FILING OF OFFICIAL TRANSCRIPT of Proceedings as to Brian David Mitchell held on February 27, 2009-Status Conference before Judge Samuel Alba. Court Reporter/Transcriber Patti Walker, CSR, RPR, Telephone number 801-364-5440. NOTICE RE REDACTION OF TRANSCRIPTS: Within 7 calendar days of this filing, each party shall inform the Court, by filing a Notice of Intent to Redact, of the parties intent to redact personal data identifiers from the electronic transcript of the court proceeding. The policy and forms are located on the court's website at www.utd.uscourts.gov. Please read this policy carefully. If no Notice of Intent to Redact is filed within the allotted time, this transcript will be made electronically available on the date set forth below. Transcript may be viewed at the court public terminal or purchased through the Court Reporter/Transcriber before the deadline for Release of Transcript Restriction. After that date it may be obtained through PACER. Redaction Request due 4/7/2009. Redacted Transcript Deadline set for 4/17/2009. Release of Transcript Restriction set for 6/15/2009. (jmr) Modified on 6/19/2009 - removed restricted text (rak). (Entered: 03/17/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Magistrate Judge Samuel Alba: Status Conference as to Brian David Mitchell held on 4/30/2009. Counsel for government and defendant present. Government counsel stated that Mr. Mitchell has been interviewed by their forensic expert. Dr. Wellner requested 6 (six) weeks to review all documents and prepare his report. Court set the matter for a status conference on 6/18/2009 at 09:00 AM in Room 248 before Magistrate Judge Samuel Alba. Government stated that they will provide all discovery by 6/18/09. All time is excluded pursuant to the Speedy Trial Act. Mr. Lambert to prepare an order. Defense counsel waived Mr. Mitchell's presence at the hearing set for 6/18/09. Attorney for Plaintiff: Richard Lambert, AUSA, Attorney for Defendant: Parker Douglas and Bob Steele, fpd. Court Reporter: Electronic.(Time Start: 8:55, Time End: 15:56, Room 248.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: SEALED MINUTE ENTRY for miscellaneous hearing as to Brian David Mitchell held on 5/7/2009. The dft was not present. The Court advised counsel that a potential witness in the forthcoming competency hearing, Dr. Paul Whitehead, is the brother of one of Judge Kimball's law clerks, but that clerk will have no involvement in the case. The Court directed counsel to consider the matter and file a written pleading by 5/29/09 indicating whether or not Judge Kimball should recuse himself from this case. A discussion was held regarding the nature and probable length of the competency hearing. Attorney for Plaintiff: Richard Lambert, AUSA; David Backman, AUSA; Diana Hagen, AUSA; Alicia Cook, SAUSA. Attorney for Defendant: Steven Killpack, FPD; Robert Steele, AFPD; Parker Douglas, AFPD. Court Reporter: Ed Young. (kmj) Modified on 10/26/2009 (kmj). Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: In Chambers Conference as to Brian David Mitchell held on 9/15/2009. On motion of the United States, and without objection from Dft, the hearing on the motion as to whether Elizabeth Smart will be allowed to testify at Dft's competency hearing will be held at 10:00 AM on 9/25/09. If Elizabeth Smart is permitted to testify concerning Dft's competency, that evidentiary hearing will be held on 10/1/2009 at 9:00 AM. The 10-day Competency Hearing set for 11/30/2009 will be held at 08:30 AM each day in Room 220 before Judge Dale A. Kimball. Evidentiary Hearing set for 10/1/2009 09:00 AM in Room 220 before Judge Dale A. Kimball. Govt's Response to dft's motion to exclude lay witness, as to Elizabeth Smart only, due by 9/21/2009, Dft's Reply due by 9/24/2009. Motion Hearing set for 9/25/2009 10:00 AM in Room 220 before Judge Dale A. Kimball. Attorney for Plaintiff: Richard Lambert, AUSA. Attorney for Defendant: Robert Steele, FPD. Court Reporter: Becky Janke. (kmj) (Entered: 09/15/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Motion Hearing as to Brian David Mitchell held on 9/25/2009 re 69 Defendant's MOTION to Exclude the Introduction of Lay Witness Testimony from Elizabeth Smart as Irrelevant, Unfairly Prejudicial and Cumulative filed by Brian David Mitchell. Defendant, in custody, was present with counsel. After being advised by the Court of his right to be present in the courtroom as long as he does not disrupt the proceedings, the defendant continued to sing and was removed from the courtroom. The Court heard the arguments presented by Robert Steele, AFPD and David Backman, AUSA, then took the motion under advisement. Attorney for Plaintiff: Richard Lambert, David Backman, AUSA's. Attorney for Defendant: Robert Steele, Parker Douglas, Audrey James, AFPD's. Court Reporter: Kelly Hicken. (kmj) (Entered: 09/25/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Dale A. Kimball: Evidentiary Hearing as to Brian David Mitchell held on 10/1/2009. The defendant, in custody, was present with counsel. The Court advised the defendant of his right to be present in the courtroom if he did not disrupt the proceedings in any way; when the defendant continued to sing, the Court ordered him removed to a room where he would be able to see and hear, but not disrupt, the proceedings. The government called Elizabeth Smart as a witness. Ms. Smart was sworn in as a witness and gave testimony. Court adjourned. Attorney for Plaintiff: U.S. Attorney Brett Tolman, AUSA Richard Lambert, AUSA David Backman, SAUSA Alicia Cook. Attorney for Defendant: AFPD Robert Steele, AFPD Parker Douglas, AFPD Audrey James, AFPD Kent Hart. Court Reporter: Kelly Hicken. (kmj) (Entered: 10/01/2009)

ORDER as to Brian David Mitchell re 97 MOTION to Unseal Document Defendant's Motion for Sanctions filed by USA. The court directs the parties to file cross briefs regarding the issues relating to the propriety of sealing certain matters regarding the competency hearing by October 20, 2009. The parties shall then file reply memoranda to the opposing party's brief by October 26, 2009. The government shall also file an opposition to Defendant's Motion for Sanctions by October 21, 2009, and Defendant shall file a reply by October 27, 2009.
